title: How to learn playing the piano in 2 months - Quora

response.answer_text: Find yourself a great teacher and practice smart every day. I’ve had lots of students who were taking part in live public presentations within 2 months of lessons. A consistent plan of musical experiences (practicing, listening, reading, writing) with the proper constant guidance should do the trick. Have fun!

Try HDpiano(dot)com if you want to learn accompaniment real fast. FlowKey for solo piano. I learned best by learning different styles of music. Example: New age piano music strengthened by fingers and developed my sense of Melody. Favorite new age pianists Ludovico Einaudi and Helen Jane Long (although the web says she's classical but I think her music sounds new age-y). Classical taught me sight reading and structure. I like Haydn and Chopin. Accompaniment taught me chords, inversions, progressions, rhythm. Pop and rock songs are my favorite to play. I exercised my fingers a lot to develop agility and stamina. Rolling a rubber ball between my fingers helped, and also scales and hanon exercises. But I believe if you want to learn something fast, start with accompaniment (chords, rhythm). HDpiano is a great website to learn your favorite pop and rock songs that you want to sing to. Check out my Instagram @mraebermudez. I learned to play piano last year. I started with accompaniment then as you'll see in my videos as I moved on to new age and solo piano. Good luck!
